dc:title: Khrushchev And Alexander Nevsky
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Retells the non-violent efforts of the 13th Century Russian hero Alexander Nevsky with the Mongol invaders. Notes the parallel to the new United Nations where East and West try to avoid atomic war where there are no victors. Urges the study of history. Keywords: books, Russia, prayer
dc:identifier: Dorothy Day Library on the Web document 771 1960-10-01 James Allaire Creative Commons Non-Commercial Share Alike 3.0 en-US http://www.catholicworker.org/dorothyday
